page.title: 01HARBURN AND CAMILTY
page.content: Bents and Camilty curns flow north across the block and join to make Linburn water (square 3). Our area has a few farms houses. Most is rough grazing and farmland. Harburn House 1804 (vide Pevner's "Lothian") square 5, visited by King Charles X of France who got to know the owners. The present owners, Spurway, have lived there for 3 generations. 300m S.E. is a monument with inscription "King Charles X 3rd September 1832. Pheasants and duck are bred on Harburn estate. The house is let for shooting; christmas trees are grown. Camilty (square 11) is the site of a disused gunpowder mill. Workers cycled form West Calder. The mill was guarded by an army platoon during the 1926 strike.
